unnormalised: **My Toddler Thinks He's a Medical Intern (and Other Pediatric Adventures)**
normalised: **My Toddler Thinks He's a Medical Intern (and Other Pediatric Adventures)**

unnormalised: So, life with a toddler. It’s basically like living with a tiny, demanding CEO who communicates mostly in grunts and sticky handprints. But lately, my little Rohan has taken things to a whole new level. He's decided he's Dr. Rohan now, apparently. He's even got his stethoscope – a repurposed toilet paper roll – and spends his days diagnosing our poor cat, Mittens, with "too much fur."
normalised: So, life with a toddler. It's basically like living with a tiny, demanding C-E-O who communicates mostly in grunts and sticky handprints. But lately, my little Rohan has taken things to a whole new level. He's decided he's Doctor Rohan now, apparently. He's even got his stethoscope – a repurposed toilet paper roll – and spends his days diagnosing our poor cat, Mittens, with "too much fur."

unnormalised: It all started last week when Rohan spiked a fever of 102°F (around 38.9°C for you metric folks). A trip to Dr. Patel at the local clinic, Apollo Children's Hospital, resulted in a prescription for Calpol and a healthy dose of cuddles. But Rohan, ever the inquisitive little soul, was fascinated by Dr. Patel's stethoscope and the whole "examination" process. Now, he's decided to give it a go himself.
normalised: It all started last week when Rohan spiked a fever of one hundred and two degree Fahrenheit (around thirty eight point nine degree Celsius for you metric folks). A trip to Doctor Patel at the local clinic, Apollo Children's Hospital, resulted in a prescription for Calpol and a healthy dose of cuddles. But Rohan, ever the inquisitive little soul, was fascinated by Doctor Patel's stethoscope and the whole "examination" process. Now, he's decided to give it a go himself.

unnormalised: Mittens, understandably, isn't thrilled. She's been subjected to multiple "check-ups" involving Rohan poking her with a plastic spoon and declaring her "all better" with a generous pat that borders on assault. I caught him the other day trying to measure her temperature with his toy ruler. "3000 degrees!" he proudly announced. Clearly, we need to work on his unit conversions.
normalised: Mittens, understandably, isn't thrilled. She's been subjected to multiple "check-ups" involving Rohan poking her with a plastic spoon and declaring her "all better" with a generous pat that borders on assault. I caught him the other day trying to measure her temperature with his toy ruler. "three thousand degrees!" he proudly announced. Clearly, we need to work on his unit conversions.

unnormalised: The real kicker? He’s started prescribing “medicine” – which consists entirely of crushed biscuits and water. My husband, bless his heart, actually took a sip. He said it tasted "interesting." I think he just wanted to avoid a toddler meltdown. I drew the line when Rohan tried to administer his "medicine" to the neighbour's dog.
normalised: The real kicker? He’s started prescribing “medicine” – which consists entirely of crushed biscuits and water. My husband, bless his heart, actually took a sip. He said it tasted "interesting." I think he just wanted to avoid a toddler meltdown. I drew the line when Rohan tried to administer his "medicine" to the neighbor's dog.

unnormalised: And the questions! Oh, the questions. "Mommy, why is Mittens' nose cold?" "Daddy, why does the doctor wear a white coat?" "What's inside your tummy?" (That last one I politely declined to answer.) It's like living with a miniature medical school professor who's majoring in curiosity and minoring in chaos.
normalised: And the questions! Oh, the questions. "Mommy, why is Mittens' nose cold?" "Daddy, why does the doctor wear a white coat?" "What's inside your tummy?" (That last one I politely declined to answer.) It's like living with a miniature medical school professor who's majoring in curiosity and minoring in chaos.

unnormalised: The funny thing is, it's kind of adorable. He's so earnest and enthusiastic. He genuinely wants to help, even if his methods are slightly… unconventional. Maybe we've got a future pediatrician on our hands. Or maybe he'll just end up being a really good biscuit-water mixer. Time will tell.
normalised: The funny thing is, it's kind of adorable. He's so earnest and enthusiastic. He genuinely wants to help, even if his methods are slightly… unconventional. Maybe we've got a future pediatrician on our hands. Or maybe he'll just end up being a really good biscuit-water mixer. Time will tell.

unnormalised: I’m thinking of investing in a small first-aid kit, just for his "practice." Maybe a few band-aids and some antiseptic wipes. And definitely a lock for the biscuit tin. The cat's giving me these pleading eyes. I think she's plotting her escape. Poor Mittens, she may need actual medical attention soon, but hopefully not at the hands of Dr. Rohan.
normalised: I’m thinking of investing in a small first-aid kit, just for his "practice." Maybe a few band-aids and some antiseptic wipes. And definitely a lock for the biscuit tin. The cat's giving me these pleading eyes. I think she's plotting her escape. Poor Mittens, she may need actual medical attention soon, but hopefully not at the hands of Doctor Rohan.

unnormalised: So, if you see a small boy running around with a toilet paper roll stethoscope and a suspiciously damp plastic spoon, it's probably just Rohan. And if he offers you some crushed biscuit "medicine," maybe just smile politely and back away slowly. Your digestive system will thank you. And tell Mittens I said sorry. She’s earned some extra treats this week.
normalised: So, if you see a small boy running around with a toilet paper roll stethoscope and a suspiciously damp plastic spoon, it's probably just Rohan. And if he offers you some crushed biscuit "medicine," maybe just smile politely and back away slowly. Your digestive system will thank you. And tell Mittens I said sorry. She’s earned some extra treats this week.
